intro: Senecio yalusay f. ligulatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish composite flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and dry conditions. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
